As more IRL brands embrace NFTs, I predict we'll see more utility tokens that build on this idea. 

If you've seen other innovative examples, drop a comment. I'd love to hear about them.

Beyond that, the project offers the typical benefits you'd expect from a utility NFT: Generative art, merch drops, charitable donations, etc

That stuff is all great. 

But the truly novel idea here is an NFT that evolves based on outcomes from a real-world sporting event.

2. #AusOpen Metaverse experience in @decentraland 

During the tournament, tennis fans can virtually attend the events in the #metaverse. They can explore re-creations of the stadiums and watch live streams of matches. 

NFT holders get VIP access. https://t.co/EGnOAOz74m

The mini-game is a genius marketing idea. It's the NFT equivalent of playing "Super Bowl Squares". 

People are more engaged watching sports when they stand to personally win something (even at long odds)

For Championship matches, the prizes are better. 

If the winning shot lands in your square, your NFT is effectively updated to a 1/1. 

Also, you win a real tennis ball used in the championship match ğŸ¾ ğŸ†

1. Match winning point mini-game ğŸ¾ 

Each NFT in the 6776 collection is assigned a unique plot on the tennis court. 

During the tournament, when a match winning shot bounces in your square, you win! 

Your NFT metadata and art will be updated on-chain, increasing the rarity. https://t.co/VZAJ0jIXmn

The #AusOpen NFT is crazy innovative. 

They've created a novel concept: an NFT that evolves and gains value based on real-time data from a sporting event.

Excited to see how the experiment unfolds.

Step 3: Once you've connected a wallet with funds, just follow the onscreen steps, and BOOM ğŸ’¥ you have a .ETH domain name!

Registering your .eth domain only takes a few minutes and a bit of #ETH (~0.012 ETH as of this moment).

Step 1: go to https://t.co/23bOoRuQs6 and search for the domain you want. 

When you find one that's available click "Connect" in the top left to connect your ETH wallet. https://t.co/HbhWgHnIiY

What's ENS? Think of it as a .com domain name for the blockchain.

Just like DNS maps human-readable text to an IP address (https://t.co/1k89TNmaew => 104.244.40.0),  ENS can map your name.eth domain to your crypto addresses, social handles,  and website.

https://t.co/CTHpf78vEA

I remember reading this .@tferriss blog post about #AntiNews and a â€œlow information dietâ€ years ago. He recommends unplugging from all sources of news.

At the time it seemed like a controversial idea to me. Now it just seems like common sense.

https://t.co/xeKmgfM70Z

Prediction: the myth that watching the news is important to being an informed citizen is unraveling. Itâ€™s an antiquated pre-internet idea.

Future generations wonâ€™t understand why we conflated consumption of ad-supported media with being well-informed.

I turned on local news for the first time since the election. The first two segments were 1) graphic footage of violence at the Capitol, 2) graphic footage of a highway crash...

Thatâ€™s not â€œnewsâ€ â€” thatâ€™s a highlight reel of horror pointed at my amygdala. 

No thanks. Iâ€™m good.
